intro: Nassauvia sceptrum, commonly known as the goldenbush, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a shrub that typically grows in rocky or sandy soils, often in arid or semi-arid environments. The plant produces showy yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are narrow and evergreen, providing year-round structure. Nassauvia sceptrum is valued for its ornamental appeal and drought tolerance in landscaping.
